question_text: After a sudden power loss in the Core Engine, Zero finds realities that appear correct in memory snapshots but revert to older states on restart. These realities had recent changes acknowledged but not yet made durable. Identify such realities.
question_answer: SELECT DISTINCT r.id FROM realities r JOIN updates u ON r.id = u.reality_id JOIN durability_logs d ON u.update_id = d.update_id LEFT JOIN disk_flush_logs f ON u.update_id = f.update_id WHERE d.ack_time < u.end_time AND f.update_id IS NULL;

question_text: Pixel discovers that some updates survived crashes while others vanished, even though both touched the same tables. The difference lies in the order changes reached persistent records. Identify updates vulnerable to partial persistence.
question_answer: SELECT u.update_id FROM updates u JOIN update_steps us ON u.update_id = us.update_id JOIN page_write_logs pw ON us.page_id = pw.page_id LEFT JOIN wal_records w ON u.update_id = w.update_id WHERE w.update_id IS NULL;

question_text: Nyx suspects torn writes where only part of a structure reached disk before the crash, corrupting internal pointers. Identify pages that were written but never fully sealed.
question_answer: SELECT p.page_id FROM page_write_logs p LEFT JOIN page_checksum_logs c ON p.page_id = c.page_id WHERE c.page_id IS NULL;

question_text: Zero notices recovery logic replayed some changes twice, inflating counts silently. These changes were recorded in persistence logs but already applied to data pages. Identify such duplicated recoveries.
question_answer: SELECT w.update_id FROM wal_records w JOIN page_write_logs p ON w.page_id = p.page_id WHERE w.apply_sequence < p.write_sequence;

question_text: Pixel finds that buffer memory evicted dirty pages under pressure, but their persistence order violated safety guarantees. Identify evictions that occurred before durability confirmation.
question_answer: SELECT e.page_id FROM buffer_eviction_logs e JOIN dirty_page_logs d ON e.page_id = d.page_id LEFT JOIN disk_flush_logs f ON d.update_id = f.update_id WHERE f.update_id IS NULL;

question_text: Nyx uncovers extreme slowdown caused by write amplification: small logical changes triggered massive physical writes across structures. Identify updates with disproportionate physical impact.
question_answer: SELECT u.update_id FROM updates u JOIN update_steps us ON u.update_id = us.update_id JOIN page_write_logs p ON us.page_id = p.page_id GROUP BY u.update_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT p.page_id) > COUNT(DISTINCT us.step_id) * 10;

question_text: Zero detects realities that passed all correctness checks yet recover incorrectly because crash windows overlapped with background maintenance operations. Identify such realities.
question_answer: SELECT DISTINCT r.id FROM realities r JOIN maintenance_logs m ON r.id = m.reality_id JOIN crash_logs c ON m.start_time BETWEEN c.start_time AND c.end_time;

question_text: Pixel suspects that some updates appear durable but were only acknowledged due to delayed IO scheduling. Identify updates acknowledged before physical persistence actually completed.
question_answer: SELECT u.update_id FROM updates u JOIN durability_logs d ON u.update_id = d.update_id JOIN io_queue_logs io ON d.io_request_id = io.request_id WHERE io.completion_time > d.ack_time;

question_text: Nyx finds that some recoveries are extremely slow because they must replay enormous histories due to missing consolidation points. Identify realities lacking recent consolidation markers.
question_answer: SELECT r.id FROM realities r LEFT JOIN checkpoint_logs c ON r.id = c.reality_id WHERE c.last_checkpoint_time < NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days';

question_text: Zero must isolate realities where crash recovery applied changes that should have been discarded, due to missing reversal markers and incomplete durability signals.
question_hint: Recovery without full context is dangerous.
question_answer: SELECT DISTINCT r.id FROM realities r JOIN wal_records w ON r.id = w.reality_id LEFT JOIN rollback_markers rb ON w.update_id = rb.update_id WHERE rb.update_id IS NULL AND w.is_applied = true;

question_text: BOSS FIGHT: The Storage Leviathan corrupts reality by exploiting torn writes, premature acknowledgments, dirty evictions, and write amplification. Zero must identify realities where all these signals overlap.
question_hint: This is physical corruption, not logic.
question_answer: SELECT DISTINCT r.id FROM realities r JOIN updates u ON r.id = u.reality_id JOIN durability_logs d ON u.update_id = d.update_id LEFT JOIN disk_flush_logs f ON u.update_id = f.update_id JOIN buffer_eviction_logs e ON u.update_id = e.update_id JOIN page_write_logs p ON u.update_id = p.update_id WHERE f.update_id IS NULL AND e.page_id IS NOT NULL GROUP BY r.id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT p.page_id) > 50;

question_text: FINAL BOSS: The Storage Engine itself fractures. Zero must isolate realities where acknowledgments preceded persistence, torn pages exist, recovery replayed changes incorrectly, background operations overlapped crashes, and write amplification magnified the damage.
question_answer: SELECT DISTINCT r.id FROM realities r JOIN updates u ON r.id = u.reality_id JOIN durability_logs d ON u.update_id = d.update_id JOIN wal_records w ON u.update_id = w.update_id LEFT JOIN page_checksum_logs c ON w.page_id = c.page_id JOIN crash_logs cr ON d.ack_time BETWEEN cr.start_time AND cr.end_time JOIN maintenance_logs m ON r.id = m.reality_id WHERE c.page_id IS NULL AND w.apply_sequence < (SELECT MAX(write_sequence) FROM page_write_logs);
